introduction: ^The water looks so beautiful. This is just what you needed.
^You and your friends are finally going on that island getaway you always talked about.
^No responsibilities, no internet, nothing to do except relax for the whole weekend.
^You feel a rush as the wind hits your face, the island closing in from the horizon.
exposition: ^Everyone files off the boat and onto the shore.
^After a short walk, you arrive at the front door of the house.
^"Well, it looks nice enough. Hopefully, the plumbing and heating still work."
^Everyone comes through the door and into the living room, bags in hand.
^Sadie slowly walks around the room, taking it all in.
^"This place is gorgeous. So where's everyone staying?"
^"Obviously. I'll take the room at the end of the hall."
^"Sadie, you can stay in the room next to mine."
^Victoria pauses and then glances over at Sam.
^"I guess that leaves the basement for you, since we didn't even know you were coming..."
^Sadie excitedly sits down next to Victoria.
^"We’re gonna throw a party, obviously. We basically have the whole island to ourselves."
^She laughs, "I mean, it is my island after all."
^"You wanna do that tonight? Aren’t you tired??"
^"Oh don’t be such a buzzkill, Ali, it’ll be fun! I’m sure there's plenty of booze to go around in this place."
party: ^Everyone is dancing and drinking as music blasts through the large speakers.
^Victoria stumbles over to Sadie. She’s clearly more than a bit tipsy, and slurs her words in response.
fight: ^“Oh hey Ali, did you ever spend that pageant prize money? You know the whole $500? Big win for you huh?” Victoria says mockingly.
^“What? You did win, right? So inspiring. Poor little Ali, climbing her way to the top.”
^The party starts quieting down, and the others start looking at each other.
^“Mad? Of course not. Just saying, people love a good sob story.”
^“Oh, come on. We all know you exaggerated, like, half of it.”
^“What was it, your mom worked three jobs? Or was it two?”
^“The details get so fuzzy when you're bullshitting.”
^“You're literally the last person who should be talking about money, Victoria.”
^Ali starts to raise her voice, Victoria’s smile falters.
^“Yeah, maybe I didn't tell the full truth, but at least my money is real. How’s Daddy’s business doing, by the way?”
^“What? You don’t wanna talk about where that trust fund comes from?”
^“You don’t know shit about my family.”
^“Oh, shut up, Sadie! The grown ups are talking now.”
^“Stay out of this, or do you want me to tell everyone about when you were sobbing to me after what happened with—”
^Sadie’s face drains of color and she looks like she’s going to start crying. Ali glares daggers at Victoria.
^“Wow. Real classy. But I guess I shouldn’t expect better from someone whose family buys their way out of consequences.”
^Ali turns on Sam, cutting her off.
^“You don’t get to act like you’re above this.”
^“Oh yeah? That’s why you spend all your time lurking to the side, right? Pretending you don’t care?”
^Sam’s tone remains flat, but she’s getting louder.
^“That’s cause I don’t care. You know not everything revolves around you, right?”
^Ali grins, seeing that she’s pushed Sam’s buttons.
^“No, you’re just mad your real family doesn’t care either.”
^“Of course, Sam here is my dear step-sister. Except—”
^“What? We’re family, aren’t we? Oh, wait—no, my family actually wanted me.”
^Sam’s fists clench at her side, and she starts breathing heavily.
^“Too bad your family couldn’t even afford to send you to college. Aren’t you working what, like, three jobs now?”
^“Okay, enough. I think we should all calm down–”
^“Funny, I don’t remember you being the voice of reason here. Don’t you remember when–”
^“No. Pick a side or stay out of it.”
^“Ali wins one pageant and thinks she owns the fucking place.”
^“No I don’t! Victoria is being completely psycho, as usual.
^You are forced to pick a side.

c-0: ^“Victoria, I think you’re picking a fight with Ali for no reason. Let’s just forget about the pageant and have a good time, okay?”
c-1: ^“Ali, why are you being so confrontational with everyone? We didn’t do anything wrong.”

vicLeaves: ^Victoria scoffs, rolls her eyes, and storms off to her room. She slams the door angrily.
^“Oh, now you have nothing to say huh? Well that’s a first.”
^Ali huffs as she heads out the front door, slamming it behind her.
aliLeaves: ^Ali shakes her head in disbelief before walking outside, slamming the front door behind her.
^The rest of the room is silent.
^Victoria grabs another unopened drink and heads up to her room without another word.
^Sadie and Sam just stand there, somewhat shocked.
^With the party ruined, Sam switches off the music and then heads off to her room.
^Sadie looks at you and shrugs, then goes to her room as well.
^The next thing you know, you're waking up and it's the next morning.

flashback: ^You’re stumbling out of the cabin and into the dimly lit porch.
^The voices of everyone shouting at each other are still ringing in your mind.
^Ali is ahead of you storming into the trees. You follow close behind her.
^It's dark outside as you make your way to the beach, approaching a still-fuming Ali.
^“Why the hell did you follow me out here?”
^“Because you stormed off! What was I supposed to do? Just let you—”
^“Yes! God, you always do this. You always have to be in the middle of everything.”
^“Are you serious? After what you just pulled in there?”
^“Oh, I’m sorry," Ali says mockingly. "Did I make things messy? Did I ruin the perfect little party?”
^“You started throwing shots first, Ali. Don’t act like you’re some victim.”
^“Oh, so that’s what this is about.”
^“You know what’s funny? You think you can just pick sides and that’s enough.”

b: ^“Of course you took her side. I should’ve known. After everything— after the camping trip–”
^“I picked your side because I had to. Because if I didn’t, you’d throw me under the bus too”
^“So that’s it. You weren’t actually on my side. You were just covering your own ass."
^“You think siding with me erases what we did? It doesn’t.”

flashback: ^“We’re not talking about this. We said we would never speak about it again-"
^"But we are. Because we can’t outrun it. No matter what I do I can never-"
^Ali stumbles, gripping her head. You can tell the alcohol is hitting her hard now.
^“You know what’s worse than what we did?”
^“That you pretend you don’t remember. Either that or you truly don’t care.”
^Ali lowers her voice to a whisper.
^Ali's slurring her words and fumbling back in the direction of the house.
^"I'm gonna tell them all what we did."
^You start to panic. Ali cannot tell the others.
^You run after her and grab her arm.
^She whips around and shoves you, hard.
^You rush back and grab her, more forcefully this time.
^She tries to shove you off but you're holding her arms.
^"Please Ali, you can't tell the others."
^"I'm telling them I don't give a fuck what you say."
^"Quit being an asshole and let me go!"
^It slowly starts to escalate until you're both wrestling with each other.
^A punch is thrown, nails scratching, shoving, it's starting to get out of hand.
^Somehow, during the fight, you once again feel sand under your feet, and it catches you off gaurd.
^You fall, Ali falls on top of you and starts grabbing your throat.
^You try to shove her off, but her drunken state has only fueled her rage and she won't budge.
^You're seeing spots. Your hands grasp for anything within reach.
^Slamming it into Ali's head, she falls on the ground beside you, and you sit up gasping for breath.
^Your head spins, the alcohol and adrenaline coursing through your blood.
^Once you can breath again, you look over at Ali.
^Oh my god… What have I done
next_morning: ^Your head is throbbing as you recall the fight from the night before.
^Victoria is already at the counter, scrolling through her phone bored.
^Sadie is at the stove, attempting to flip a pancake with questionable success.
^Sam sits in the corner, sketching in a notebook.
^“Well, look who finally decided to wake up."
^“Almost noon. You must’ve had a good night. Where’d you even end up sleeping?”

c-0: ^"Oh I think I passed out on the couch after the party."

couch: ^Sam glances up briefly and laughs under her breath.
dontRemeber: ^"You were probably throwing your guts up after all those shots."
^“Oh... you could've slept in my room. I wouldn't mind.”
afterSleep: ^"Kind of. They might be a little… crispy.”
^She scrapes a pancake off the pan.
^“Oh, fantastic. Burnt carbs. Just what I need.”
^“You could cook something yourself, you know.”
^“I could. But watching you struggle is much more entertaining.”
^“Besides, it’s not my fault this kitchen is cursed. Who even designed this stove?”
^"Someone who knew not to let you near open flames."
^“Wowwww. After all I've done for you."
^“So anyways, what’s the plan for today? Or are we all just going to sit around, nursing hangovers?”
^“Or, well, a walk. A very short walk.”
^"It's not like this island is very big."
^“Well, sorry my dad didn't buy a bigger island 20 years ago-”
^“Not much of a hike person, huh?”
^“More of a ‘sip cocktails by the pool’ person.”
^Victoria smiles at you while Sadie rubs her head wearily.
^“Ugh, my head is killing me. I think I drank too much.”
^“No shit. You were singing karaoke to a song that didn’t even have lyrics.”
^Sadie groans and covers her face with her hands.
^Sadie puts her head down on the table.
^“Oh god. Let's talk about something else... What do you want for breakfast?”
pancake: ^You start eating your pancakes while the room falls into a comfortable silence.
edible: ^“You’re really living life on the edge.”
^You look in the fridge and grab what's left from last night while the room falls into a comfortable silence.
nothing: ^You sit back down at the table, still groggy from sleep.
^The room falls into a comfortable silence.
breakfastChoice: ^After a while, someone glances at the empty seat at the table.
^“Did…did she not come back last night?”
^“Well she stormed off yeah, but I figured she would've come back.”
^You try to remember what happened last night after the fight, but your head starts pounding.
^“Please, Ali isn’t the ‘sleep all day’ type.”
^“If she was here, she’d be making us all suffer through her morning workout routine.”
^"Good luck with that, I'm going to the beach."

bodyFound: ^Everyone gathers back into the living room.
^"Oh my god, you guys… Ali’s on the beach."
^"She’s - she’s dead. I just found her lying there.”
^"Oh my god, it was so gross."
^Everyone is looking at Victoria in silent disbelief.
^Victoria starts pacing around the room, fake gagging.
^“Ugh Daddy’s gonna kill me when he finds out!”
^"No... no she’s not... she couldn't be...”
^“Sadie, I know what a dead body looks like.”
^“I don’t know... her head was all bloody. It was-”
^“God, I think I’m gonna be sick.”
^"We should stay here. I mean what else are we supposed to do?”
^“It’s not like she’s going anywhere, and I don’t want the house to start smelling like…”
^Sadie looks like she's on the verge of tears.
^“We-we should do something. Like a ceremony or... I don’t know, a funeral."
^She pauses, thinking. The room remains silent.
^"We should just deal with the body for now... before it starts to rot."
^"That is literally the most disgusting thing I have ever heard.”
^"What? It’s the practical thing to do.”
^“No no we can’t. Guys, she deserves better than that! She was our friend.”
^"Everyone calm down! I think we should..."
^How should we deal with the situation?

c-0: ^“Why don’t we all just stay here and take a moment to process this.”
^Nobody says anything, but they nod in agreement.
c-1: ^“Sadie, I think you’re right. Ali was our friend, she deserves a proper burial.”
^“You guys have fun with that, I’m not going back over there.”
^, let’s go to the beach before it gets dark.”
^Sam pauses, and looks like she’s going to say something…
^Sadie looks upset, but doesn’t try to stop her.
^You both turn and go out the front door.
c-2: ^“Sam’s right, we should bury the body before it becomes a…problem”
^“It is the practical thing to do.”
^She goes up to her room without saying anything.
^You and Sam grab shovels and head out the door.

sadieBedroom: ^You and Sadie head upstairs to check Ali’s bedroom.
^Sadie opens the door and you both peer into the room.
^"It doesn't look like she's in here."
^"The bed doesn't even look slept in..."
^Sadie walks along the side of the bed, running her hands along the comforter.
^"Maybe she just made the bed this morning?"
^"Yeah she is the type to do that."

s: ^"Where do you think she went off to?"
^"How long have you and Ali known each other?"
^"We should probably head back out there."

c-0: ^"Not as close as we used to be."
^"I didn't mean to pry or anything."
^"You've just seemed kind of off this weekend."
^"I just wanted to make sure you were okay."
^Sadie smiles and looks at her shoes.
c-1: ^"I didn't mean to pry or anything."
^"You've just seemed kind of off this weekend."
^"I just wanted to make sure you were okay."
^Sadie smiles and looks at her shoes.
^"Maybe she just went for a jog around the island?"
^"She likes to work out in the mornings."
c-2: ^"We've been friends since we were kids."
^"I've only known you guys the past few years, but wow you guys go way back."
^She looks like she's lost in thought.

headBack: ^You both step out of the room, softly closing the door behind you.

samOutsideHouse: ^You and Sam head out the front door and onto the porch.
^"I guess we can wander a bit and look for her."
^"She can't be too far, this island isn't very big."
^You both start walking a little ways away from the house.

s: ^"Did you sleep alright in the basement?"
^"I'm sorry about all the drama yesterday."

c-0: ^"I mean it's cold, and there's just a couch down there..."
^"I really wasn't looking forward to coming here in the first place but-"
^Sam glances at you for a split second.
c-1: ^"Yep. I'm surprised she never told you she had a step sister."
^"Me too. She was always kind of a private person anyways."
^"That or she didn't want you guys to know about me."

c-0: ^Sam looks like she wants to say something, but decides against it.
c-1: ^Sam smiles a bit and looks away.
^"You seem cool too, I can see why she's friends with you."

c-2: ^"I should've said something when it started getting out of hand."
^"It's fine. I know how Ali can be sometimes."

choiceHub2: ^"But you didn't need to get dragged into it like that."
^"But both Victoria and Ali were way out of line."
afterChoiceHub2: ^"I'm sorry, I didn't mean to pry."
^"No it's okay. I'll talk to you about it later, alright?"
^"We should probably be heading back pretty soon though."
headBack: ^"You're right, maybe one of the others has found her already."
^You both head back to the house and through the front door, shutting it softly behind you.

vicBeach: ^You and Victoria head off in the direction of the beach.
^"You don't think we should help look for Ali?"
^"Maybe she's just avoiding us after what happened last night."
^"Clearly she needs some liquid courage in her system to say what she really thinks."
^"And now that she's sober she can't stand behind her words"

c-0: ^"If anything, she might just feel guilty."
^"Yeah she really owes me an apology."
c-1: ^"Yeah well she can just keep hoping."
^"I'm not apologizing unless she apologizes first."

afterChoiceHub: ^You both continue walking, the edge of the tree line in sight, with the ocean barely visible beyond.
^"On the bright side, there's still plenty of alcohol left."
^"And it happens to be the best cure for a hangover."
^Victoria, excited about the idea of a beach and day drinking, jogs up ahead of you onto the sandy beach.
^You are about to follow when you stoop down for a second to tie your shoe.
^Victoria comes sprinting back to where you're standing.
^"We need to go back to the house. Right now."
^Victoria isn't listening. She's too busy frantically pushing her way through the trees back to the cabin.
^"Oh my god. Oh my god. Oh my god. Oh-"
^You have no choice but to follow her.
^You both make it back to the house in a matter of seconds.
^"Will you just slow down for a second?"
^But Victoria's already opened the door and headed inside.

stayHome: ^Sadie heads to her room, leaving you with Sam and Victoria in the living room.
scene12: ^“You look like you’re about to cry.”
^“You sure? Your face is looking awfully red.”
^“God, you’re always so moody. You know that?”
^“Always skulking around like some sad little weirdo.”
^“Maybe if you didn’t act like a freak, your family wouldn’t hate you so much.”
^Sam takes a deep breath, clearly trying to hold herself back.
^Victoria cuts you off and starts yelling at Sam instead.
^“Oh, what? Am I being “harsh”? As if we weren’t all thinking it anyway.”
^“They loved Ali, and you were just... there. Being a burden.”
^“Just like you are right now. I can’t believe Ali brought you along.”
^“Just STOP. You don’t know shit about me or my family!”
^“Does shitting on me make you feel better about yourself?”
^“I’m not the pathetic one here, but nice try though!”
^Sam lets out a huff and starts walking towards the basement door.
^After the door slams behind her, you glance down and notice Sam’s phone still sitting on the side table.
^Victoria eyes the phone and picks it up.
^“Well well well... What do we have here?”
^“Uh, maybe we shouldn’t look through that.”
^“Why not? Aren’t you even a little curious?”
^“Ugh this is so sad. She doesn’t even have anything interesting on here.”
^"Ya know, you said some kinda mean stuff to her.”
^“And maybe now isn't the time to be picking fights?”
^“You act like this is some big deal.”
^“You know, in high school, there was a girl just like Sam, so pathetic and childish.”
^“I was only trying to toughen her up, of course. It was hilarious.”
^“But she ended up transferring schools, what a buzzkill.”
^“So trust me, this isn’t a big deal. I think Sam can handle herself.”
^You and Victoria stare at each other for a second.
^“Here, you want it? I’m bored of it."
^She tosses you the phone and starts to head upstairs. You are now alone in the living room.
^Are you going to look through Sam's phone?
lookAtPhone: ^“Mom: Ali said you were acting weird again. Stop sulking. It’s embarrassing.”
^“Dad: Ali just won the competition. You should be happy for her.”
^“Dad: Maybe if you actually tried at something, people would like you more.”
^“Mom: Why can’t you be more like Ali?”
^“Dad: Ali’s going to do great things. You should ask her for advice.”
^“Mom: You’re such a disappointment. She always had to pick up the slack for you.”
^“Mom: Do you ever think about how much easier things would be if you weren’t like this? If you just tried to be normal?”
^You quickly put down the phone, shocked at the messages you've read.
^I guess Victoria wasn’t wrong then. No wonder Sam was getting so pissed off earlier.
^I wonder how she’s feeling about all this.
leavePhone: ^Are you sure you don't want to look at it?

c-1: ^I can't look at it. It's just wrong. I hope Sam's okay though.

end12: ^I wonder what everyone is up to right now
honorAli: ^You and Sadie leave the house and head to the beach.
^You want to talk but she seems too upset right now.
^You decide to give her some space and walk along in silence.
^As you make your way to the shore, you approach Ali's body.
^You and Sadie start gathering flowers and sea shells to make an altar.
^You watch Sadie take Ali’s bracelet off her wrist and put it in her pocket.
^"I just— I wanted something to remember her by.”
^“She was my best friend. I just... I don’t want to forget her.”
^“I know I probably seem... weird to you.”
^Sadie gingerly starts laying the flowers near the altar, then looks up at you nervously.
^“I just... I never really felt like I was enough. Ali— she was so confident. She always knew what to say, what to do. Everyone loved her. I just wanted to be like her.”

s: ^“I didn’t know you felt that way”
^“It sounds like you cared about her a lot.”
^"We should probably be heading back pretty soon."

c-0: ^“You don’t have to be like her to matter, Sadie. You’re enough as you are.”
^“That’s nice of you to say. But I don’t think I’ve ever been enough for anyone.
^“I always feel like I have to try so hard just to keep people around.”
^“Like, if I don’t make myself useful, if I don’t say what people want to hear, then they’ll just... forget about me.”
^“You really think people would just forget you?”
^“I know they would. It’s happened before. People move on so easily.”
^“Ali never had to try. She just had this... gravity. People wanted to be near her.”
^“And you felt like you had to work to stay in her life?”
^“Maybe. I don’t know. I wanted to be someone she needed. I wanted to be someone important to her.”
c-1: ^“What it’s like to admire someone so much that you just want to be near them all the time…”
^“You want to know everything about them.”
^“That’s why I need to keep something of hers. It’s like… a part of her will always be with me.”
^“I mean… it makes sense to want to remember her.”
c-2: ^“I just wish… I could’ve been more for her, you know? Maybe then—”

headBack: ^Sadie sighs and nods, placing the final seashell on the altar.
^You and she stand, brushing the sand off your hands.
^There’s a moment of quiet between you two.
^Sadie sighs again and then turns to leave. You both walk back to the house in silence.
^When you arrive back at the cabin, Sam and Victoria are sitting in the living room.
^It seems you entered in the middle of a conversation…

buryBody: ^You both start walking towards the beach in relative quiet.
^You glance over at Sam, who's face is unreadable.
^“I know we don’t know each other that well but…”
^“I’m here if you want to talk.”
^“You know, I never really fit in with Ali’s group.”
^“My parents just— They thought it’d be good for me. To hang out with ‘the right people’ ”
^You both arrive at a spot in a clearing a little ways away from the beach.
^Sam digs her shovel aggressively into the ground.
^"Like this whole thing? The parties, the drama, the underhandedness? Not really my scene."
^“...No offense or anything. You seem different from the others.”

s: ^“So, you and Ali weren’t close then?”

c-0: ^"I dunno. I guess I just like people who aren’t exhausting to be around."
^A few moments of silence go by as you both continue digging.
c-1: ^“So far you haven’t randomly lashed out at any of your close friends unprovoked.”
^“Pretty low bar but I guess that’s what we’re dealing with here.”
^“Look at that, we have so much in common.”
c-2: ^“I mean, they like to pretend we’re normal, but we’re not.”
^“Not to trauma dump on you, but yeah Ali was always their favorite.
^“I think they wanted me to be more..well someone more like Ali.”
^"Never really had many friends either. Not real ones, at least.”
^“My family makes me hang out with Ali’s friends.”
^You look around and then look back at Sam, sarcastically.
^“But it's not like Ali ever wanted me around. I just tried to stay unseen and out of the way around her friends."
^“Wow, thanks for the feedback. Glad to know I’m at least mildly tolerable.”
^The hole is deep enough now. You and Sam pause for a second to catch your breath.
^"Ali had everything. Perfect looks, perfect life. But I don’t think she was as happy as people thought she was."
^"Just a feeling. Sometimes the people who seem like they have it all together... don’t."

headBack: ^You and Sam lift Ali’s body and lower her into the grave. You both look down at her.
^You and Sam start shoveling the sand back on top of Ali's body, filling the hole.
^Once you’re done, you both stand back and look at the disturbed sand under which Ali is laid.
^“Ya know, you’re not so bad to talk to.”

b: ^ “Another compliment? This has to be a world record.”

scene13: ^You and Sam make it back to the house and head into the empty living room.
^"Sounds good, I think I'll go find the others."

c-0: ^I'll see what Sadie is up to.
c-1: ^I wonder what Victoria is up to.
c-2: ^I better go see if Sam's okay.
c-3: ^I think we all need to have a bit of a talk.

findSam: ^You head outside to look for Sam.
^You're about to call her name when you see feet dangling from the roof above the porch. You recognize Sam's shoes.
^Walking around to the side of the house, you climb up the ladder propped against the cabin.
^Sam hears you approaching and turns around.
^"Victoria was being harsh. She didn’t have to say all that."
^"She likes kicking people when they’re already down. It’s her favorite sport."
^"I just... I don’t know. I’ve been dealing with so much, and Ali—"
^"It’s complicated. Ali and I... we had history. Not good history."
^"She always knew exactly how to get under my skin and make me feel like nothing."
^"Oh also, sorry to cut you off, but uh—this is yours. Found it in the living room."
^Sam's eyes go wide and she quickly grabs the phone from you.

tellTruth: ^"I’m sorry, it was just some stuff from your family, and how they're always comparing you to Ali, and-"
^"I hated her, okay?! Is that what you want to hear?!"
^"She always ruined everything. And I let her. I let her have that power over me."
^"I spent my whole life trying to get people to notice me, to matter even a little."
^"But she always sucked up all the air in the room, like there wasn’t space for anyone else."
^"No one ever saw me when she was around. And if they did, it was just to compare me to her."
^"And now she’s gone. And you know what? Maybe I should be crying, or mourning, or something."
^"Because a part of me feels relieved and maybe that makes me an awful person."
^You definitely have more you want to say but you're not sure if it would help or make things worse.
^Sam looks like she might continue, but she just sighs and lowers her head.
^I should probably give her some space.
^You climb down off the roof and step back onto the porch.
lie: ^"No, I didn’t look. I wouldn’t do that."
^You try to lighten the mood a little bit.
^"What would I have found if I had?"
^You turn to her, smiling a bit. But she quickly puts the phone away and won't meet your eyes.
^I guess she's not in the mood.
^I should probably give her some space.
^You climb down off the roof and step back onto the porch.
relief: ^"No, I didn’t look. I wouldn’t do that."
^You try to lighten the mood a little bit.
^"What would I have found if I had?"
^You turn to her, smiling a bit. But she quickly puts the phone away and won't meet your eyes.
^I guess she's not in the mood.
^I should probably give her some space.
^You climb down off the roof and step back onto the porch.

findSadie: ^You head to Sadie's room to see what she's up to.
^Do you want to just look around or snoop through her room?

lookAround: ^You notice a worn band jacket draped across Sadie's bed.
^Wandering over to the mirror, you see a small photo is tucked into the mirror frame.
snoop: ^You find a small, tin box hidden beneath a stack of notebooks.
^Opening it reveals an odd collection of trinkets—rings, a bracelet, a lipstick tube, scraps of paper, and other various items.
^Several of these items clearly belonged to Ali, but you think the rest belong to other people in the house.
^Is this a used make up wipe??
^And is this one of Ali’s hair bands?
^What is Sadie doing with all this stuff?
^Something about this really rubs you the wrong way.
doneBedroom: ^Nothing else of interest stands out to you, so you decide to try to find Sadie.
^Looking around the house for a bit, you finally find Sadie sitting by the fire pit in the backyard.
^"Hey there you are, I looked in your room but you weren't there... so I came out here.”
^"Oh hey. Yeah. Just needed some air."
^Mention the band jacket on her bed.
photoSadie: ^"I saw that photo in your room. The one on the mirror. Who’s in it with you?"
^"Oh. That’s me and my sister. We were close when we were kids, before... you know. Life happened."
^"Oh I knew you had a sister but... you don’t talk about her much."
bandJacketSadie: ^"I saw the band jacket on your bed when I was looking for you."
^"Not at all! I bet you were great."
^"Eh, I was okay. It was just nice to be part of something. Like, a group where I actually belonged…
^She trails off. You both sit in silence for a minute, but for a second you catch her staring at you.

b: ^ Do you confront Sadie about the stolen items in her room?

confrontSadie: ^"Sadie... I found something in your room. A box with... stuff."
^"Some of Ali’s things. Some of ours."
^"Yeah. Just... reminders when I miss yall."
^"I don’t mean anything by it. It’s not like I sell them or anything."
positiveSadie: ^You laugh and lightly push her shoulder.
^"Thanks for not being weird about it."
neutralSadie: ^"I just sometimes feel like physical things help remind me of people I care about."
^“But you just take things without asking?”
^“I know, I should ask, I’m sorry.”
negativeSadie: ^"Uhh, what the heck, Sadie?? That's so creepy."
^“How much of our stuff have you just taken without us knowing?”

b: ^ You decide not to confront Sadie about the stolen items you saw.
^ It’s definitely weird, but maybe it’s better not to know…

continueConversation: ^"What about… everything else? How are you holding up?"
^"Honestly? I feel like I can’t breathe. Like, none of this is real. But it is. And now we just have to... live with it."
^"But at least I’m not alone in it. Right?"
^"Of course not. I’m always here for you."

findVictoria: ^You make your way to Victoria's room and knock on her door.
^"If I say no, will you leave?"
^You look around the room, admiring the decorations.
^“Yeah, well I spent a lot of time decorating it.”
^"Oh, sure. My friend just died, my weekend’s ruined, and now I get to sit here waiting for the next horrible thing to happen."
^“Daddy’s never gonna let me borrow the island again.”

sympatheticV: ^"I know this is a lot. You don’t have to pretend it’s not getting to you."
vContinues: ^"Look, it’s complicated, okay? But Ali was... Ali. She wasn’t exactly easy to love."
^"Yeah, sure. If that’s what you wanna call it."
^"More like two people who couldn’t decide if they wanted to kill each other or rule the world together."
^"I mean, we had fun, don’t get me wrong."
^"But Ali— she always had to be on top. Always had to be the center of everything."
^"And if she wasn’t? She made damn sure someone else paid for it."
^You notice a small, framed photo on Victoria’s nightstand.
^It's an old picture of her and Ali at what looks like a school event.
^"Yeah, well. Just because she was a nightmare doesn’t mean we didn’t have good times."
^You try to go forward and grab the picture but your foot hits something under the bed.
^You look down and see a baseball bat rolled out from under Victoria's bed.
^Victoria freezes for a moment and glances at you, eyes wide.
^“It’s not important, it was a long time ago.”
^In one fluid motion, she brushes you to the side and kicks the bat back under the bed.
pressV: ^"Then why is it on the island? And uh– right there, under your bed?"
^"I don’t know. Maybe I threw it under there and forgot about it."
^"Maybe? What do you mean, you don’t remember?"
^"Oh my God, drop it. It’s nothing, just go bother someone else."
^Victoria shuffles you out the door and into the hallway, closing it firmly behind you.
letGoV: ^Victoria starts quickly shuffling you towards the door.
^"Okay, well, I need to go take a nice long bath. I’ll meet you outside later.”
^She closes the door in your face.

scene17: ^You take a few minutes to yourself in the living room.
^Everybody seems to be making themselves scarce, but you think you all could benefit from talking as a group a little bit.
^Things were left a little chilly last time you were all down here together.
^You go around gathering the others for a little meeting.
^Victoria comes out of her room, drying her wet hair with a towel.
^"This is not what this weekend was supposed to be. I wanted to relax and heal my inner self."
^Sadie and Sam both walk into the living room.
^Sadie is holding the book she was reading, while Sam carries her sketchbook.
^"No kidding. We were supposed to have fun and relax. Heal our inner self not... whatever this is."

flirtV: ^"I don’t know how you do it, but you always manage to keep it together, even now."
^"Of course she is. No one’s ever accused her of caring too much."
^Victoria ignores her and saunters up to you.
^. You always know what to say."
^She leans her head on your shoulder jokingly, but puts her hand on your lower back.
^You turn your head to look at her and your eyes meet for a second before you both look away.
^“Oh wait my bad, she does care.”
^“She cares about daddy’s money and being
flirtSadie: ^You turn to Sadie and take a step closer to her.
^"You don’t think we still can’t have any fun?"
^Sadie looks at you with a shy smile.
^"I suppose we can still make it a good weekend, can’t we?"
^"Yeah, because nothing says ‘good weekend’ like dodging a murder investigation."
^Sadie takes a step closer to you, her smile growing wider.
^"I think anything will be fun as long as you do it with me."
^You both smile at each other for a second before Victoria interrupts.
flirtSam: ^"You always seem so collected. Even when everything’s falling apart. It’s kind of… impressive."
^Sam teases and takes a step closer to you.
^"Probably easy when you don’t feel anything in the first place."
^“Don’t listen to her. I can feel plenty of things.”
^You roll your eyes while Sam laughs to herself.
^“Don’t get a big head, I said KIND of impressive.”
^“I’ll keep that important distinction in mind.”
biggerThings: ^"Whatever. We have bigger things to deal with."
^"I guess I’ll say it since we’re all thinking it…"
^"Yes, Sam, that's what head trauma means."
^"Jumping to conclusions pretty quick there, huh Sadie?"
^“She was probably just drunk off her ass and fell or something.”
^“Unless she was just that much of an attention hog that she had to off herself for one last moment in the spotlight.”
sideSadie: ^"We don’t really know, right? It’s possible she... did it herself."
^"If that’s true, there had to be a reason."
^“You think she just smashed her own head into a fucking tree or something??”
^"Maybe it wasn’t a wound, but something else... I mean, you were in shock, V."
^"I know what I saw. I’m telling the truth."
^"Stop staring at me like I did something!"
sideSam: ^"Why are you so quick to say it was suicide, Sadie?"
^"I just think it seems like the most likely explanation.”
^"Isn’t it better to believe she wasn’t... murdered?"
^"Nobody was saying she was murdered, jeez."
^"Well, V did say something about a head wound."
^"Jesus you guys, she was blacked out.”
^“How hard is it to believe she tripped and fell?"
^"You’re getting awfully defensive here, Victoria. Nobody was accusing you of anything."
^“I’m just trying to be reasonable here!”
^"You guys are just trying to make me look bad."
sideV: ^"That makes sense, V. She probably just tripped and fell."
^"Plus, she’s the one who saw the body."
^"If she says it looked normal, then it probably is."
^"Right, because she’s suddenly the expert on head wounds."
^"If she tripped and hit her head, there’d be something nearby that she hit it on. And there wasn’t."
^Everyone turns to look at Victoria, who looks pissed.
^"Well– I don’t know, maybe there was! Forgive me for not taking detailed note of the entire surroundings at that exact moment."
pressV: ^"Why do you sound so defensive, V?"
^"Because I know what you’re all thinking. And it’s bullshit."
^"You can understand why it looks bad, though."
^"I mean you’re the only one who’s seen her body."
defendV: ^"Just because it looks bad doesn’t mean it was her."
challengeSadie: ^"And Sadie, why did you just automatically declare it a suicide?"
^"Because we don’t know anything, and turning on each other isn’t going to help."
^“But the easiest first conclusion is to assume it was an accident…”
^"Ok sure, go ahead and make me look bad. Keep stirring the pot, it’s really helpful here."
everyoneSus: ^"The truth is, we don’t know anything for sure."
everyoneSplit: ^Everyone looks at each other in silence, all incredibly tense.
^"I don’t care what you guys do."
^Sadie shrugs and heads towards the door, grabbing her water bottle.
^Sadie huffs in frustration and heads out the door.
^You and Sam look at each other for a moment.

whatToDoNow: ^What do you want to do now?
vSauna: ^You make your way to the sauna, joining Victoria in the water.
^"This whole weekend has been... a disaster."
^"All relaxed, glowing... It’s a good look."
^, if you keep talking like that, I might start to think you actually like me."
^"Then I’d say you have good taste."
^"You’d fit right in at one of those high-end luxury spas."
^"The kind where people just lounge around looking effortlessly gorgeous."

^"You do work hard to impress me."
^"I don’t need to work hard to impress you."
^"But seriously, are you okay? I mean, really okay?"
^"I want to be, but... this whole thing is just so messed up."
^"I keep thinking about Ali. She... she had this way of making everything about her."
^"Yeah, and now we all have to sit around and unravel this mess she left behind."
^"I’m just saying what no one else will."
^"I mean, she always had to be the center of attention, didn’t she?"
^"You couldn’t just talk to her about anything without it somehow turning into her crisis."
^"It’s not like I’m glad she’s gone, but..."
^"It’s kind of a relief that maybe, just maybe, I won’t have to put up with her constantly trying to control everything."

c-0: ^"It’s not even mine, it’s my dad’s."

c-1: ^"But you can always talk to me, V. You know I wouldn’t judge you."

b: ^"Hey, I found a note in your room from Ali. What’s that about?"
^"I don’t know what you’re talking about."
^"It was a note with her handwriting. Looked like something she’d left for you."
^"And why the hell are you going through my stuff?"
^"I don’t need to explain my room to you. Whatever you thought you saw, it’s not what you think."
^"It was a note, Victoria. From Ali."
^"Maybe it’s better if we talk about it."
^"I said there’s nothing to talk about."

c-0: ^"Look, I’m just trying to understand what’s going on."
^"Fine. Ali... she found out about my family."
^"And Ali was threatening to expose me."
^"She had this way of holding things over your head."
^"This just shows you never know what people are really like..."
^"So you shouldn’t trust the others... They could be dangerous."

c-2: ^"Look, you never know what people are really like."

c-1: ^"I don’t know, V... maybe everyone is just scared."

b: ^"At least you’re staying in my room."

^"Anyways... come sleep in my room tonight."
^"At least we won’t be alone that way."

saunaSleep: ^“I’m gonna get out before I become a full on raisin. See ya inside, V.”

sadieBeach: ^You head to the beach and find Sadie already walking along the shore.
^"I know everything is, well, a lot right now."
^"Yeah. Well, I guess I’ve been thinking a lot about Ali, actually."
^Sadie gets a familiar wistful look in her eye.
^"Like, she was the kind of person you couldn’t help but admire, you know."
^"Yeah, I know you two were close."
^"Close? Oh, no. I mean, no one could be that close to her."
^"But, you know, I always tried to be around her.”
^“She had this way of making everyone feel important, like you could be anything when you were with her."
^"She was everything. I just wanted to be a part of it all. To be around her..."
^"Like, I’d watch her talk, and I’d think, 'Wow, she has all the answers.' She was so... smart, and everyone liked her so much."
^"I wanted to be like her, y’know? And the way she could just... command attention, like everyone was just drawn to her, no matter what."
^"I used to think, if I just spent enough time with her, maybe I could—"
^"No I get it. Ali had that effect on a lot of people..."
^Sadie looks like she's getting nervous and starts to fidget.
^This is not the first time you’ve seen her do this.
^"You look like you’re about to burst with something."
^"Are you sure? You know you can always talk to me right."

b: ^"Yeah I know. I guess... I feel like I’m just not enough. You know?"
^"I try so hard to be seen, to be noticed, but no one ever looks at me the way they looked at Ali."
^"Maybe if I had more... stuff, people would notice me."
^"Maybe if I was just like her... maybe then I’d feel like I mattered."
^"You know that’s not true Sadie. We love you for you."

c-0: ^"Well, about the stuff in your room..."
^"You know the box you have of small trinkets..."
^"Not all of those are yours right?"
^"Yeah, I mean, people leave stuff around, and I just..."
^"Thought I should hold onto them, just in case, you know?"

b: ^Sadie pulls out Ali's necklace from under her sweater.
^"I thought this was a good way to remember her... and that she’s always with me even if she’s gone."
^"Wait Sadie, isn’t taking that a crime?"
^"And I know Ali would want it with someone who will appreciate it."

beachContinue: ^You and Sadie walk in silence for a bit.
^"So do you really think it might be Victoria?"
^"So how did you two end up as friends anyway? You seem so different."
^"Yeah, we’re not exactly the same. But she’s just... she’s so confident."
^"She knows how to make everyone listen, and that’s something I never had”
^“I guess I wanted to be around that."
^"And as for her... I think she just likes that she can walk all over me."
^"I’m easy to control. I don’t stand up for myself. She knows I’ll just do whatever she says, and... I guess that works for her."
^"So things have been rocky between y'all then, huh?"

b: ^"At least I won't be alone tonight."
^"If you wanted to, you could sleep in my room tonight. It’s no big deal, I mean, only if you want to."

beachContinue: ^“I’m heading back to the house now."

samWalk: ^You head off in the direction Sam went and eventually catch up to her along the path.
^“So, are you normally the type to take a stroll in the woods or should I be concerned?”
^“... not knowing is the fun part.”
^“I saw you had a book earlier. What were you reading?”
^"You know, people losing their minds, getting swallowed up by their own fears. That kind of thing."
^"People don’t really change. They just get better at hiding things."
^“Oh, please, no one is better at hiding shit than my family."
^"One thing they never had trouble hiding was how much they adored Ali and hated me."

b: ^“Did that ever make you... resent her?”
^"I used to wish she’d just disappear."
^"But I never thought that I would.. .I-I mean, that she would be dead."
^"Of course not. What kind of question is that?"
^"My family just sucks, and at the end of the day, she was still my sister."
^“I didn’t realize it was that bad.”
^“Why would you? I spent my whole life trying to get people to notice me, to matter even a little."
^"But she always sucked up all the air in the room, like there wasn’t space for anyone else. No one ever saw me when she was around."
^"And if they did, it was just to compare me to her."
^"Ali was untouchable, and I was just... there."
^"A joke. A footnote in her story.”
^“Yes it is. She always ruined everything and I let her. I gave her that power over me.”

samWalk: ^“I get that. But you’re not alone anymore."
^"I notice you, and I’m here for you.”

b: ^"You like to draw, right? I saw some of your work."
^“I flipped through a couple pages. It looked good but..."
^"You can be honest with me. If there’s something you want to talk about..."
^"It’s not just drawings. It’s everything I can’t say out loud."
^“Have you thought about talking to someone about it, maybe a professional?”
^"I want to process everything myself first. The emotional manipulation and trauma... I’m not ready to face it all.”
^"Everyone has a phase, and it’s all about interpretation. Don’t overthink it."
^“Just the first few pages, then I came out here to find you.”
^"I mean, I don’t love sharing my work, it feels too personal."
^"Everything in there… it’s the deepest parts of me.”
^"What do you like to do for fun?"
^"I draw sometimes. Helps me clear my head."
^"Can I see some of your work?"
^"Maybe. If you don’t run screaming first."
^"I doubt that. I used to doodle a lot as a kid, but I never stuck with it."
^"Yeah? What kind of stuff did you draw?"
^"Oh, you know, embarrassing little comics. Superhero knockoffs, probably."
^"But, I mean, I get why drawing helps."
^"It’s like having a way to put your thoughts somewhere outside of your own head."
^"Exactly. It’s like... translating feelings into something tangible."
^"Sometimes, it’s the only way to make sense of things."
^"Do you ever want to do something more with it? Like, art school or—"
^"So you’re crashing in my room, huh?"
^"You know, if you haven’t picked a room yet, mine’s not the worst option."

samWalk: ^“Alright, I think I've had enough nature for one day.”

b: ^"Glad I have someone to talk to now."

clues: ^You hear plates crash from the kitchen area.
^You turn your head and there's at least two plates worth of shattered ceramic littering the floor around Victoria's feet.
^“Oh my God, are you okay, V? Here let me help!”
^As she jumps up, the bag she was holding falls, and everything inside spills out.
^Clothes, hairbrush, personal items that all belonged to Ali.
^Even some photos of Ali printed out, you recognize a few from her Instagram, but all these others...

^“Is this what you were gonna talk to me about?”
^“No, I wanna know why the fuck you have all of Ali’s shit?"
^"And what’s with these photos? Are you some kind of stalker??”
^“I don’t know what you’re talking about.”
^"Oh so you didn’t follow her around all the time and memorize her schedule?"
^"And you didn't take these creepy photos?"
^"And I guess that also means you didn't confess your love to her like a week before we came here?"

c-1: ^"Well I- I was going to tell you-"

^"And now that she’s gone you have no one to make you feel like the worthless piece of shit that you are.

^"What did you do after Ali ran off?"

^"Well, I didn’t do it, but I’m not gonna lie she got what she deserved."

endings: ^"Hello...? You just spaced out for like 20 seconds."
^You brain must have blocked out that night.
^Tell them you don’t know what happened.
suicide: ^"I think my brain blocked it out, but now it’s... coming back."
^"I went after her. I don’t even know why—"
^"I just knew she was messed up."
^"She was really drunk and really angry."
^"Like she wanted to fight or something."
^"She was kicking and scratching and screaming all this stuff—"
^"How awful she was, how her life was shit, how everything she touched turned to garbage."
^"Then she started hitting herself. Like, actually hitting her head against a tree."
^"I tried to stop her, but she kept pushing me away, telling me I didn’t understand."
^"She picked up this rock. And she just..."
^"There was blood everywhere. I was so scared."
^"I went back to the cabin to get help but I..."
^"I guess I passed out. I was still drunk."
^"I didn’t remember anything until just now."
^"She’d been through stuff, yeah. I knew she felt guilty about Gretchen. But she was planning to move out."
^"She wanted to go back to school. She had plans."
^“Who the hell is Gretchen? What are you talking about?"
^"Yeah okay but come on, she was wasted."
^"The alcohol was probably messing with her head. It doesn’t always make sense."
^"Since you're always following her around like a lost dog?"
^"I just think... something feels off about this."

c-0: ^"Ali and I were talking that night. You guys weren’t there."
^"She was saying things that concerned me, okay?"
^"That’s why I went after her in the first place."
^"I was trying to stop her from doing something stupid."
^"I guess... I couldn’t help her in the end."
^"I still think it’s weird as hell, but..."
^"I guess you did what you could."
c-1: ^"I don’t know, Sadie. I guess we didn’t know her like we thought we did."
^"We’re just gonna have to deal with the police when we get back..."
^"And hope we can forget this whole thing."

believe: ^"I knew we shouldn’t have opened that last bottle of Malibu."

b: ^"She never seemed so angry or troubled..."

believe: ^“Yeah, I mean, she never seemed like that."
^"But she was really struggling that night."
^"I never thought it would go that far."
^"Yelling at me, punching at anything that came near. And then she started saying how worthless she felt, how she couldn't live with herself anymore..."
^"It was like... like she was already gone."
^"Y’all know we’re gonna have to deal with the police when we get back, right?"
^"As if that’s gonna be anything other than a waste of time."
^I can’t give up my whole life over something like this.
